c.s: HelloWorld class inherits from TopWindow class.
Menu and status bar objects are declared.
Empty line separates declarations from function definitions.
Function to modify the 'File' menu bar item.
Function to modify the main menu bar.
Function to display information about the program.
Declaration of public members.
Defining CLASSNAME as HelloWorld.
Constructor for the HelloWorld class.
Function declaration for the About function
Opening curly braces for the About function
Printing out the prompt message with formatting
Closing curly braces for the About function
Method implementing File menu
Add Bar to window
Add About option to File menu with callback to About method
Include a separator in the File menu
Add Exit option to File menu with callback to Close method
Close method called when Exit option is selected
The colon in the if statement is printed
The colon in the if statement is printed
Add menu item named 'File' and attach click event to 'FileMenu' method
The menu is added to the main window

The constructor method code (HelloWorld::HelloWorld()) for document which begins at line 0 doesn't require any arguments. It will initialize the Welcome message with the default value or an empty string.

AddFrame() adds the frame object under the current GUI element - the document. The parameter object menu is inherited from the parent (GUI) class. This creates a window for the menu part and will be visible by default.
Status bar is a sub menu of the overall document of the window. It gets added here to display information about the items displayed inside the menu. It will not remain fixed in size.

menu is an object which is created outside the constructor. The Set() method is called to attach or render the parent window as well as status bar within it. So this connects them in a readable manner.

A string variable status is set to display a welcome message on the screen when the application starts. This is achieved by modifying the initial value of the variable until a more intent specific message takes over its scope.
End of the constructor block. Any code written after this line will not be executed until the constructor is called again.
This is the main function that starts the program.
Start of the code block.
Set the language to English.
Create a new instance of the HelloWorld class and run it.
End of the code block.

a.r: int WinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance, HINSTANCE, LPSTR lpCmdLine, int nCmdShow)
